game_description: *NEW UPDATE* Introducing experimental Hand Tracking! Enjoy a new way to play with your very own HUMAN hands! *NEW DLC* Provide 5-Star service and enjoy endless tasks in new DLC РђўVacation Simulator: Back to Job Welcome to the Vacation Simulator: a rough approximation of VACATION inspired by real human NOT JOBBING. Reallocate your bandwidth and get ready to splash, sРђЎmore, snowball, and selfie your way to optimal relaxation! Amenities: РЌЈ Experience Vacation Island, your destination for optimal relaxation and/or efficient memory-making! РЌЈ Customize a virtual YOU for picture-perfect selfies! РЌЈ Wave to interact with a colorful cast of Bots! РЌЈ Splash in the silicon sea and bask in simulated sunlight, all without getting sand in yourРђд hands! РЌЈ Get lost connecting with your roots, nodes, and branches... then get actually lost on a hike! РЌЈ Elevate your ice-sculpting skills to new heights and reach peak cozy by knitting mittens for a snowhuman!
Languages: English, French (France), German, Japanese, Korean, Spanish (Argentina), Spanish (Chile), Spanish (Colombia), Spanish (Mexico), Spanish (Peru), Spanish (Puerto Rico), Spanish (Venezuela)

review_4: Vacation simulator definitely isnРђЎt the most realistic vr game, but the world still feels real and fun to explore. Love the game! My only tiny issue is that its not very fun to replay after you finish the first time, because its not very different the second time you play, but you can use the extra save slots for friends or family if your nice. This is definitely my favorite game this team has made!
review_5: Maybe it's because vacations are naturally better than jobs, but I thought this was a great improvement over job simulator. First, I liked how you could move around in the worlds and feel like you were exploring. Second, this is the first game I've played in 2 years of VR that I felt compelled to share a selfie on social media of the outcome of a task I completed, such as the geyser, the top of the mountain and the wildlife underwater, because it just looked so cool. Third, the tasks were great and would have done more of some of the tasks if there were additional levels, like the sand and ice castles, the skiing, etc. Maybe the developers in an update could make a water skiing task, like the snow skiing, I'm sure that would be as fun. The only not so positive thing was that some of the food orders were difficult to figure out. Those advanced food orders were the only things I really had to YT.
